::: {.cell}

:::




# Tables intro

This chapter shows a few simple examples of including tables and getting cross-referencing to work across formats (HTML, Word, PDF). See @sec-kableflexgt for more examples and comparisons of different table outputs.

In this chapter, I am going to use {flextable} for Word and HTML and {kabelExtra} for PDF. See @sec-kableflexgt for a comparison of {flextable}, {kableExtra} and {gt}. There is a current problem that Quarto is not processing the cross-references with {flextable} into PDF and Word. But this is a known problem and they are working on it. {flextable} is the only table package that I have found the tends to work as expected across platforms. The {officer} package uses it so it works well with Word and works well with LaTeX.

*Note, I am using some customized functions to be able have a uniform look for my tables. These are in `tables/_common.R`.


## Example table

This is an example a table. We can reference @tbl-example easily and it is auto-numbered. 




::: {#tbl-example .cell tbl-cap='This is a simple table.'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
\begin{table}
\centering
\begin{tabular}[t]{lrrrrrr}
\toprule
  & mpg & cyl & disp & hp & drat & wt\\
\midrule
Mazda RX4 & 21.0 & 6 & 160.0 & 110 & 3.90 & 2.620\\
Mazda RX4 Wag & 21.0 & 6 & 160.0 & 110 & 3.90 & 2.875\\
Datsun 710 & 22.8 & 4 & 108.0 & 93 & 3.85 & 2.320\\
Hornet 4 Drive & 21.4 & 6 & 258.0 & 110 & 3.08 & 3.215\\
Hornet Sportabout & 18.7 & 8 & 360.0 & 175 & 3.15 & 3.440\\
\addlinespace
Valiant & 18.1 & 6 & 225.0 & 105 & 2.76 & 3.460\\
Duster 360 & 14.3 & 8 & 360.0 & 245 & 3.21 & 3.570\\
Merc 240D & 24.4 & 4 & 146.7 & 62 & 3.69 & 3.190\\
Merc 230 & 22.8 & 4 & 140.8 & 95 & 3.92 & 3.150\\
Merc 280 & 19.2 & 6 & 167.6 & 123 & 3.92 & 3.440\\
\bottomrule
\multicolumn{7}{l}{\rule{0pt}{1em}\textit{Note: }}\\
\multicolumn{7}{l}{\rule{0pt}{1em}kable}\\
\end{tabular}
\end{table}
:::
:::




## Including table files

It is often good to have your files in separate files so that when you edit your tables, you only have to work on the table code.

````markdown
```{r child=here::here("tables", "Table_flex.Rmd")}
```
````















<!-- The yaml is not needed. Left here in case I need to copy this file into
     a non-Quarto project. -->

::: {.cell}

:::

<!-- Generic flextable example from the flextable reference manual. 
     The tbl-xyz label is important. This allows cross-referencing. -->


::: {.cell}

:::

<!-- This auto-numbering bit is different (and better) in Quarto -->

::: {#tbl-flexchild .cell tbl-cap='This table is created in `Table_flex.Rmd`. flextable.'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
\providecommand{\docline}[3]{\noalign{\global\setlength{\arrayrulewidth}{#1}}\arrayrulecolor[HTML]{#2}\cline{#3}}

\setlength{\tabcolsep}{2pt}

\renewcommand*{\arraystretch}{1.5}



\begin{longtable}[c]{|p{1.34in}|p{0.45in}|p{0.96in}|p{0.95in}|p{1.07in}}

\multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedright}p{\dimexpr 1.34in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.45in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{Df}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.96in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{Deviance}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.95in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{Resid.\ Df}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 1.07in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{Resid.\ Dev}}}} \\



\endfirsthead

\hhline{~~~~~}

\multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedright}p{\dimexpr 1.34in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.45in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{Df}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.96in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{Deviance}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.95in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{Resid.\ Df}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 1.07in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}}{\fontsize{11}{11}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{Resid.\ Dev}}}} \\

\hhline{>{\arrayrulecolor[HTML]{000000}\global\arrayrulewidth=1pt}->{\arrayrulecolor[HTML]{000000}\global\arrayrulewidth=1pt}->{\arrayrulecolor[HTML]{000000}\global\arrayrulewidth=1pt}->{\arrayrulecolor[HTML]{000000}\global\arrayrulewidth=1pt}->{\arrayrulecolor[HTML]{000000}\global\arrayrulewidth=1pt}-}

\multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedright}p{\dimexpr 1.34in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{12}{12}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{\textbf{ethnicty:grade}}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.45in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{12}{12}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{3}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.96in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{12}{12}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{7.2}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 0.95in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}}{\fontsize{12}{12}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{92}}} & \multicolumn{1}{!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}>{\raggedleft}p{\dimexpr 1.07in+0\tabcolsep+0\arrayrulewidth}!{\color[HTML]{000000}\vrule width 0pt}}{\fontsize{12}{12}\selectfont{\textcolor[HTML]{000000}{73.3}}} \\





\end{longtable}
:::
:::

We can add a captions to a flextable with `set_caption` but then we won't have access to Quarto's cross-format (Word, HTML, PDF) cross-referencing engine. We can also use `tab.cap="caption"` in the chunk yaml but again we don't get the cross-referencing engine.

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set_caption(ft, 
  caption = "a table caption with set_caption", 
  style = "Table Caption")
```
:::






## Cross-references

In Quarto, [table links](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/cross-references.html#tables) use the table label `@tbl-tablabel` where `tablabel` is the label you put on the table chunk. In the text it looks like this @tbl-tablabel. The chunk yaml looks like this

```
#| label: tbl-tablabel
#| tbl-cap: "my caption"
```




::: {#tbl-tablabel .cell tbl-cap='This is a table with a number.'}
::: {.cell-output-display}
\begin{table}
\centering
\begin{tabular}[t]{lrrrrrrrrrrrr}
\toprule
Year & Jan & Feb & Mar & Apr & May & Jun & Jul & Aug & Sep & Oct & Nov & Dec\\
\midrule
1954 & NA & NA & NA & NA & NA & NA & 1 & 1 & 3 & 5 & 9 & 9\\
1955 & 11 & 14 & 17 & 16 & 16 & 17 & 18 & 20 & 21 & 21 & 23 & 24\\
1956 & 26 & 28 & 30 & 30 & 32 & 32 & 35 & 37 & 39 & 41 & 42 & 43\\
1957 & 44 & 45 & 45 & 45 & 46 & 46 & 48 & 49 & 50 & 51 & 53 & 55\\
1958 & 56 & 58 & 62 & 64 & 64 & 65 & 65 & 66 & 66 & 69 & 69 & 70\\
\addlinespace
1959 & 70 & 71 & 72 & 74 & 76 & 78 & 79 & 81 & 81 & 83 & 85 & 86\\
1960 & 88 & 88 & 89 & 89 & 90 & 90 & 90 & 91 & 93 & 94 & 95 & 98\\
1961 & 102 & 102 & 102 & 103 & 105 & 105 & 107 & 108 & 110 & 111 & 112 & 114\\
1962 & 115 & 115 & 114 & 116 & 117 & 118 & 121 & 123 & 125 & 126 & NA & NA\\
\bottomrule
\multicolumn{13}{l}{\rule{0pt}{1em}\textit{Note: }}\\
\multicolumn{13}{l}{\rule{0pt}{1em}kable}\\
\end{tabular}
\end{table}
:::
:::




## Dynamic table captions

You can create captions dynamically.




::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dt <- mtcars[1:10, 1:6]
tbl_cap <- paste("This is a dynamically created caption. The length of mtcars is", nrow(mtcars), "rows. Here we show", nrow(dt), "rows.")
```
:::




Unfortunately you cannot dynamically create your chunk labels too.




::: {#tbl-test3 .cell tbl-cap='This is a dynamically created caption. The length of mtcars is 32 rows. Here we show 10 rows.'}
::: {.cell-output-display}

Hornet 4 Drive & 21.4 & 6 & 258.0 & 110 & 3.08 & 3.215\\
Hornet Sportabout & 18.7 & 8 & 360.0 & 175 & 3.15 & 3.440\\
\addlinespace
Valiant & 18.1 & 6 & 225.0 & 105 & 2.76 & 3.460\\
Duster 360 & 14.3 & 8 & 360.0 & 245 & 3.21 & 3.570\\
Merc 240D & 24.4 & 4 & 146.7 & 62 & 3.69 & 3.190\\
Merc 230 & 22.8 & 4 & 140.8 & 95 & 3.92 & 3.150\\
Merc 280 & 19.2 & 6 & 167.6 & 123 & 3.92 & 3.440\\
